spell.name: Abduction

components.m: an object belonging to the target

entries: You touch a humanoid and attempt to forcefully teleport both of you. A creature that has a CR or level higher than yours is unaffected by this spell. Otherwise, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be teleported with you. You arrive at a location of your choice within 500 feet. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet." That space must be on the ground or on a floor.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take {@damage 4d6} force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you. On a successful saving throw, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, the spell can affect any type of creature, or you can teleport to any destination that you are familiar with on the same plane of existence.

spell.name: Aberrant Restraints
entries: You cause three aberrant tendrils to emerge from the rod or scepter you hold, driving them at three targets you can see within range. Each target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the tentacles. A creature can use its action to end the condition by succeeding on a Strength check against your spell save DC. During your turn, you can use a bonus action to cause any creatures that are {@condition restrained} by the tendrils to take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you conjure an additional tendril for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Absorb Negative Energy

time.condition: which you take when would become cursed, diseased or take necrotic damage

entries: The spell allows you to absorb part of the deadly oncoming energy and use it to shield yourself. If you cast this spell when you take necrotic damage, you halve the necrotic damage you take, before gaining temporary hit points equal to the damage you prevented. These temporary hit points last for the duration of the spell.

If you cast this spell when you would be cursed or diseased, you absorb the incoming malady, cancelling the effect and gaining temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Adanar's Alteration
entries: You reach to alter the appearance of a humanoid creature you touch that has flesh and bones. You decide what the creature looks like, including its height, weight, facial features, sound of its voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make the creature appear as a member of another race, though none of its statistics change. It also can't appear as a creature of a different size than it is, and its basic shape stays the same; if it's bipedal, you can't use this spell to turn it quadrupedal, for instance.
While the spell is active, you can use an action to touch it and cause the creature to take on a different form or revert to its original shape, ending the spell.

An unwilling creature can make a Constitution saving throw to avoid the spell's effects. If you use your action during the duration of the spell to change the target's appearance again, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effects on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level, the duration becomes 24 hours. When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 9th level, the duration becomes Until Dispelled.

spell.name: Adanar's Protecting Flesh

m.text: a pound of thick flesh and a piece of naquatl stone worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell was created by Adanar, a wizard that lived during the age of the Old Emancy of Alvaran and was obsessed over his safety.

You enchant the underlying layers of your flesh with the magic of this spell, imbuing them with latent resilience. When you are damaged, you can use your reaction to manifest the latent vigor hidden in your flesh, ending the spell and gaining 30 temporary hit points as your flesh thickens and hardens.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the temporary hitpoints you gain increase by 5 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Adapting Flesh
entries: You reach into your body and momentarily unlock its potential. For the duration of this spell, you can use your reaction whenever you take damage to fortify yourself. When you do so, you take half as much damage from the triggering attack.

spell.name: Adrenaline Surge

time.condition: which you take when you enter initiative

entries: When you enter initiative, you can use your reaction to imbue a creature you can see within 30 feet of you with intense adrenaline. If the target's proficiency bonus is equal to or less than the spell's level,  the target can use its reaction to immediately take a turn if it is willing. At the end of this turn, it must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

spell.name: Aesthetic Idol
entries: You wrap yourself in idyllic beauty. For the duration, anyone who can see you within a 30-foot radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition charmed} as they perceive your appearance to be a perfect embodiment of beauty. While {@condition charmed}, a creature makes Wisdom ability checks at disadvantage, as it is bewildered by the almost divine aura of beauty you exude. A creature remains {@condition charmed} for as long as it can see you, or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it, at which point the spell ends. Once the effect on a creature ends, it is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 hour.

If an affected creature can no longer see you, the effects of the spell are suspended on it, but they resume the moment it is able to see you again. A creature makes the saving throw against this spell with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it, or if it has seen you before in the past while you were not under the effects of the spell, since it has memories that conflict with what it appears to perceive now.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, any creature that can see you is affected by the spell, no matter how far away it is.
Ideals of Beauty

This ideal of beauty is not meant to be sexual in nature, nor does it have to do with bodily appearance or facial features. It is a kind of philosophical and abstract ideal of beauty that one also finds in nature, art or philosophy. Creatures affected by this spell would not be any more interested to have sexual relations with you than they would be with a god or a higher being.
If a creature, according to the DM, is not capable of having an ideal of beauty, it is unaffected by this spell.
An Affront to the Gods

This spell is banned by most churches in the Coronian Lands, as castings of it are perceived to be blasphemous and an attempt to immitate the sublime beauty of the divine, which belongs only to the Gods.

spell.name: Airborne Missile
entries: You conjure a missile of magical force and launch it against a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} force damage. For the duration, you can use your bonus action to move the missile up to 30 feet and make another spell attack against a creature within range. If you miss on the attack, the spell ends and the missile dissipates into nothing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Arctic Blizzard
entries: You summon a whiteout blizzard in a 30-foot radius around you. When you cast the spell, you can select a number of creatures to be unaffected by the spell. For the duration, the area is difficult terrain and heavily obscured for any affected creatures, who are also {@condition deafened} while they are inside it. In addition, an affected creature that starts its turn within the blizzard must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 10d8} cold damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

While the spell is active, mark one blizzard token for each round that passes. You can use your action on any of your turns to extend your hands and bring about the culmination of the blizzard. Each affected creature within the blizzard must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 10d8} cold damage, plus {@dice 1d8} for each blizzard token. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage. The spell then ends.

spell.name: Aldrian's Arctic Sphere
entries: You manifest a sphere of clear blue ice around a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature becomes encased within the sphere if it is large or smaller. On a success, or if the creature is larger, the target takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage and the spell ends.

The ice sphere is a structure that has 100 hit points, an AC of 10, and vulnerability to fire damage. The ice sphere provides total cover to any creature inside it, and it is mostly transparent. A creature that ends its turn inside the sphere takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage on a failed Constitution saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Aldrian's Cold Brew
entries: You wave your hands over a cauldron of boiling water and rapidly cause its temperature to plummet. Up to 6 creatures can drink from the cauldron in the next minute in order to benefit from the drink's magical properties. A creature that drinks from it gains 10 temporary hit points and becomes adapted to cold climates, as described in page 110 of the DMG.

While a creature has these temporary hit points, it has resistance to cold damage, it is unaffected by difficult terrain created by non-magical ice or snow, and has advantage on ability checks made to navigate snowy terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 5 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Aldrian's Frostburn
entries: You fill the extremities of a creature you can see with extreme cold. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, a creature takes {@damage 8d8} cold damage and the spell ends. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 8d8} cold damage and you can select whether the frostburn appears in its arms or legs. If you frostburn its arms, the creature has disadvantage on weapon attacks and strength ability checks for the duration. If you frostburn its legs, its speed is reduced to 10 feet for the duration.

At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make another saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d8} cold damage on a failure. On a success, the spell ends on it. If you maintain concentration on the spell for its entire possible duration, the frostburn becomes permanent and the creature loses function on one arm or one leg.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Aldrian's Hailstone Swarm
entries: A torrent of hailstones shatters on a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or it takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and its speed isn't affected. The area then becomes difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Ice Cage
entries: You draw moisture from the air and coalesce it into a large chunk of ice that you create at a point within range. Each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} cold damage and become {@condition restrained} in the ice. A creature takes half as much damage on a success and isn't {@condition restrained}.

The boulder of ice is an object that has 30 hit points and an AC of 13. It is immune to cold damage, and non-magical slashing or piercing damage, but it is vulnerable to fire damage. A creature {@condition restrained} in the ice is freed only once the chunk of ice is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the ice chunk's hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Ice Shards
entries: You coat your hands in smoking ice and launch an ice shard against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} cold damage and its movement speed is reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute. This effect is cumulative. If a creature's speed is reduced to 0 due to the effects of this spell, you have advantage on attack rolls you make with ice shards against it.
For the duration of the spell, you can use your action or your bonus action to attack with an ice shard again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of each ice shard increases by {@dice 1d10} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Shivering
entries: You conjure extreme cold in a 40-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. For the duration, each creature that starts its turn within the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} cold damage, taking half as much damage on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw also begins shivering uncontrollably for 1 minute. If it tries to cast a spell with a verbal component, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the casting of the spell fails and the spell slot is wasted. On a success, the shivering stops.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Alvaran Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon pulses with dark power. The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage to the target, and it must succeed on a Constitution save or its physical vitality is impaired. Until the spell ends, the target has disadvantage on any Constitution saving throws made to resist a condition, and whenever the target takes necrotic damage, it takes an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. A creature affected by this spell can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effects on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Anger of Hadar
entries: You channel negative energy from the void and propel it outwards in all directions around you. Any creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage, while on a failure, you can also choose to push the creature 10 feet away from you as it is knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Anti-Death Shell
entries: A protective shell of translucent energy forms around a willing creature you touch and extends in an a radius of 10 feet around it. Any undead creature that attempts to willingly enter the area must first succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is unable to do so. The creature can repeat the saving throw when it attempts to enter the area again in another of its turns.

spell.name: Apparition of Death
entries: You create a spectral apparition of the grim reaper at an unoccupied space within range. Each creature in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on that space must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw if it can see the apparition or become {@condition frightened} by it for the duration of the spell.

When a creature enters a space within 30 feet of the apparition, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw if it can see it, or it becomes {@condition frightened} by it. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that has the effect end on it early is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 hour.

spell.name: Apparition of the Void
entries: An apparition of horror and existential emptiness manifests at an unoccupied space you can see within range. The apparition remains in that space for the duration of the spell and exerts an influence over the area around it in a 20-foot radius. Any creatures in that area are unable to regain hit points while the apparition remains.

Any creature that starts its turn in that area, or is there when the apparition first appears, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition frightened} of the apparition for the duration of the spell or until it succeeds on a repeated saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th. Alternatively, you can choose to enlarge the apparition's area of effect. The radius increases by 5 feet for each two slot levels above 5th (25-foot radius at 7th level, and 30-foot radius at 9th level).

spell.name: Appetite for Destruction
entries: You awaken the immediate need for destruction in the heart of a creature you can see within range. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effects of this spell. Otherwise, the creature can immediately take a full turn. During this turn, the creature must do its best to cause as much harm and destruction as possible.

If the target ends this turn without killing a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it loses {@dice 10d10} hit points. If the creature also failed to cause any harm during its turn, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or die.

spell.name: Arcane Artillery
entries: You launch a ball of arcane force against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d10} force damage. If the target is closer than 120 feet away from you, you make the attack with disadvantage.

If you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20}, the ball explodes, dealing the same damage to all creatures within 30 feet of the target. If you roll a natural 1 while you had disadvantage on the attack roll, the projectile explodes as you launch it, dealing half as much damage to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Arcane Orb
entries: You hurl a mote of pure arcana at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage. If the target is currently affected by a spell, the arcane energy draws the bolt and you make the attack roll with advantage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Arcane Shackles
entries: You launch an arcane chain through the air that entangles itself around a creature's body. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and the shackles bind to its body until the end of its next turn. If it tries to move before then, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, its speed is 0 while the shackles remain.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Aridan's Blinding Surge
entries: You let brilliant light surge forth through you in a line 5 feet wide and 60 feet long towards a direction of your choice. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. The creature that is first in the line makes its saving throw with disadvantage, and on a failure, it is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aridan's Celestial Burst
entries: You draw light from the heavens and let it erupt through a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} radiant damage, taking half as much damage on a success. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

If you roll an 8 in any of the damage dice, any creature that failed its saving throw becomes {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn, as it stands awestruck by what its eyes saw in the heavenly light. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature can't make any attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aridan's Celestial Flame
entries: You cause a 5-foot-diameter sphere of celestial flame to form in an unoccupied space within range. The sphere forms in brilliant light, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius, and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The sphere occupies its space and burns hot to the touch. Any creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that is within 5 feet of the sphere makes its saving throw with disadvantage. The sphere can't be extinguished with water or by the wind.
During your turn, if you are within 40 feet of the sphere, you can use your bonus action to dispel the effect and absorb the light into you, gaining {@dice 3d6} temporary hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire and radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th, as do the temporary hit points you gain.

spell.name: Aridan's Purification
entries: You speak a powerful word of cleansing. A creature of your choice that you can see within range becomes enveloped by a holy light. All conditions on it end, and all curses on it are removed, as if by the remove curse spell cast at 6th level. If the creature's maximum hit points have been reduced, they return to normal and can't be reduced for 24 hours. Additionally, you can end the effect of a harmful spell on it if the spell is of 6th level or lower, and for the next 24 hours, no effect can cause the target to be unable to regain hit points.
If an undead creature hears the words you speak and is within 60 feet of the target, it immediately takes {@dice 6d6} radiant damage and can't take any reactions until the next turn.

spell.name: Ariella's Daliance
entries: You target yourself and another creature you touch and enchant both of you against prying eyes. For the duration of the spell, you are {@condition invisible} to any creature that you do not wish to see you, including to creatures viewing you through scrying sensors or divination spells. The spell ends if either of you deal damage to a creature in any way.

spell.name: Assimilate Knowledge
entries: You focus your mind on a non magical book or other written materials that you touch, and let the knowledge encased within them flow through your mind. You gain the information contained in the book or written materials you examined as if you had read them.

spell.name: Aura of Desiccation
entries: You emit an aura of desiccation in a 30-foot radius, stealing the life force of nearby creatures and blocking the natural cycle of living energy. When you cast this spell, each creature of your choice within the aura must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d4} necrotic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

On the rest of your turns, as a bonus action, you can cause a creature you can see within the aura to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 4d4} necrotic damage and another creature of your choice within the aura gains half as many temporary hit points.
In addition, whenever a creature within the aura regains hit points, the hit points it regains are halved.

spell.name: Aura of Sanctity
entries: You let your hate against harm and violence overwhelm you, forming an aura with a radius of 15 feet around you. When a creature within the aura deals damage to an ally of yours, you can use your reaction to condemn its actions. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. The target automatically fails the saving throw if the damage it dealt reduced a creature to 0 hitpoints.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius of the aura around you increases by 5 feet for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Aurunist Rune
entries: Warding light spright springs forth from your hand and engraves the Aurinist Rune on an object or a willing creature's skin. For the duration, any creature of the rune bearer's choice within 30 feet of the rune that casts a spell which deals necrotic damage or belongs to the school of necromancy has to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage for each spell level, and is unable to cast that spell again for 24 hours.

In addition, if the bearer of the Aurunist Rune is ever reduced to 0 hitpoints due to necrotic damage, they can fall to 1 hitpoint instead, and receive a number of temporary hitpoints equal to their level. The rune then fades, as the spell ends.

spell.name: Avada Kedavra

m.text: a wand worth at least 700gp

entries: You speak a foul phrase and direct your inner hate towards a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack as you send a green energy beam towards your target. On a hit, the target dies unless it uses a Legendary Resistance to resist the effect. This spell cannot be counterspelled. However, when you make the attack roll, you can't benefit from any bonuses to your attack roll, apart from advantage.

spell.name: Azanar's Darkbolts
entries: You conjure three bolts made of energy drawn from the Shadowfell. Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. A target only makes this saving throw once against this casting of the spell, even if it is hit by multiple bolts.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create an additional darkbolt for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Blinding Ray
entries: You create three rays of radiant energy and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. If all rays hit the same target, and it fails its saving throw, the creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blood Hold
entries: You twist your hands, attempting to control the blood of a creature within range. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or its speed becomes 0 for the duration of the spell. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Undead and construct creatures, as well as creatures that don't have blood, are immune to this effect.

When you see a creature within range moving, you can cast this spell as a reaction if you expend a number of your hit dice equal to the level of this spell, targeting the creature or creatures you see moving.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them. When you do so, you must concentrate on the spell to maintain its duration.

spell.name: Bloodbend

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range make a weapon attack

entries: You briefly exert your control over a creature's body as it makes its strike. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you can direct its attack to any creature of your choice within its reach. The creature makes that attack with disadvantage. Undead and construct creatures, as well as creatures that don't have blood, are immune to this effect.

spell.name: Bludgeon
entries: You reach out towards a creature you can see within range and bludgeon it with raw magical force. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage, taking half as much damage on a success. If the creature dies, its remains are disfigured to the point that its identity can't be recognized by inspecting the body.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bone Break
entries: You reach out and snap the bones of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its bones snap in horrific angles. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage, and you can choose whether to break the bones of its legs or its arms. If you break the bones of its arms, the creature has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls and takes bludgeoning damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier whenever it makes a weapon attack. Additionally, if the target tries to cast a spell with a somatic component, it must first succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell is wasted. If you break the bones of its legs, the creature falls {@condition prone} and is unable to stand up. These effects persist until the creature receives healing equal to half of its maximum hit point score. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, but is otherwise unaffected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the target suffers the effects of the bone breaking even if it succeeds on its saving throw.

spell.name: Break Concentration
entries: You target a creature you can see within range that is concentrating on a spell or other effect and attempt to assail its mind. The creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have its concentration broken. A creature that has its concentration on a spell broken in this way takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell it was concentrating on. If the level of the spell that ended was lower than the level of this spell, the target takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell instead.

spell.name: Breathless
entries: You use necrotic energy to suck out the breath of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the creature can't breathe for the duration of the spell and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, it takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both of the necrotic damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bulwark of Faith

components.m: a shield emblazoned with a celestial sigil of protection

entries: You manifest a towering celestial shield around an allied creature you can see within range. The target gains a +3 bonus to its AC for the duration of the spell, and whenever it takes damage by a melee attack, its attacker takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage as its attack is rebuffed. If a melee attack misses the target, its attacker takes half as much damage instead.
When you cast this spell, you can also choose to teleport to an unoccupied space adjacent to your target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Burst
entries: You cause a creature you can see within range to explode. If the target has 30 or fewer hit points, it explodes and instantly dies. Any creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 30 bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the hit point threshold of the target, and the damage dealt, increases by 5 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Cease
entries: You bellow words of condemnation and reproach at a humanoid within range that you have seen damage a creature during the last minute. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or be affected by the spell. If the target has reduced any of your allies to 0 hitpoints in the last minute, the target makes the saving throw with disadvantage. The target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if they are immune to being {@condition charmed}. Until the spell ends, or until the creature takes damage from one of your allies, the target cannot take the attack action or cast a spell that deals damage to a creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Celestial Retort

time.condition: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

entries: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily doused in radiant light. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.
Strife Domain. Enemies and Strife.

spell.name: Challenging Call
entries: You challenge the will of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, you have advantage on melee weapon attack rolls against it until the end of your next turn. If it succeeds on the saving throw, you fail the challenge and have disadvantage on attack rolls against it for the same duration.
A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isn't affected.

spell.name: Change of Ways

components.m: a vial of holy water that the target swallows

entries: You touch a humanoid that has been violent or cruel in the past and let out a wave of peace and amity from your heart towards it. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or let its heart change as a response to the harmonious feelings you let it experience. The target loses any intense feelings bloodthirst from their mind, and they do not seek to revert back to their previous self. Any time they may attempt to damage a creature while doing so with murderous intent, they must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with disadvantage, or they are unable to complete the action.
If the target ever kills a creature while under the effects of this spell, they can repeat the initial Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Charm's Binds
entries: You point at a creature you can see within range and bind its favor with yours. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you. The target cannot attack or willingly harm you while under the spell. In addition, whenever you unwillingly take damage, the target takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level of higher, the psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Circle of Nightmares
entries: A sphere of nightmarish spectacle forms in a 30-foot radius sphere from a point you can see within range. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

The sphere remains for the duration of the spell and its area is heavily obscured. Any creature that starts its turn there must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Claws of Fire
entries: You shoot out dark claws made of fire to assail your enemies. Choose 3 creatures you can see within range. Each target must succeed on a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw (your choice) or take {@damage 2d10} fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the claw remains lodged in the creature's spine for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to succeed on a Medicine check against your spell save DC. While the claw is lodged in its body, a creature has its movement speed reduced to half if it failed a Dexterity saving throw, or it can't take any reactions if it failed a Constitution saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can shoot an additional claw for each slot level above 3rd. Each claw must target a different creature.

spell.name: Clear Senses
entries: An aura of mental clarity emanates from you, focusing the senses of you and your companions. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has advantage on perception checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the casting grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Cloak of Shadow

m.text: a thread of shadow worth at least 20 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You cover yourself in the shadows that surround you. While you are in complete darkness, you are {@condition invisible} and have resistance to necrotic damage. If you take radiant damage, you are unveiled from your shadows and become visible until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Cloud of Disruption

components.m: a magical tuning fork tuned to the note B

entries: Disrupting energy emerges and spreads from you out to a radius of 15 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} force damage or half as much damage on a success. If a creature that is concentrating on a spell fails this saving throw, its concentration is broken and it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} of force damage for each level of the spell they were concentrating on, up to {@dice 5d6}.
Any magical effects in the area are also dispelled as they are hit by the disruption, as if they were targeted by a dispel magic spell at 5th level.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the force damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the disruption can dispel spells up to a level equal to the level of the spell slot you use.

spell.name: Cloud of Lightning
entries: A cloud of lightning energy spreads out from you out to a radius of 15 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and be unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't otherwise affected.
A creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is wearing armor made of metal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Coat in Darkness
entries: You touch a non magical object and coat it in abysmal darkness. The object becomes heavily obscured. All that can be seen of it is its vague shape coated in darkness. A creature other than you that holds the object takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. For the duration of the spell, each time a creature targets the object with divination magic, it takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage and the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases. It becomes 8 hours for a 4th level spell slot, 1 day for a 5th level spell slot, and until dispelled for a 6th level spell slot.

spell.name: Columns of Radiance

components.m: an orb of celestial marble, native to the Upper Planes, worth at least 10,000 gp

entries: You reach forth with your hand and beckon the heavens to come closer. Three columns of radiant light appear in points you can see within range. Each cylinder has a radius of 10 feet and is high enough to reach the sky or the ceiling of whatever environment you are in. Each creature in the area of the columns when they appear takes {@damage 10d6} radiant damage on a failed Dexterity saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that starts its turn in the area of the columns must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 10d6} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a success. Each column sheds incredibly bright light in a 100-foot radius. Any creature inside the column is {@condition blinded}, unless it is a Celestial, in which case it also takes no damage from it. A creature in the area of more than one column is affected only once.

When you cast this spell, there is a 50% chance that a celestial spirit will descend from the heavens and appear through each radiant column. These spirits have the statistics of a celestial spirit (TCE) cast with a 5th level spell slot, and are controlled by the DM. The DM determines whether each spirit is an avenger or defender, and each spirit acts in aid of you and your companions in its own initiative. The spirits remain in the material realm even if your concentration on the spell is broken, though they might re-enter an existing radiant column and ascend back to the heavens if they deem that their task is done.

spell.name: Concussive Shell
entries: You throw a projectile that explodes with concussive force in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that sphere must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} thunder damage and become dazed for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't become dazed. A dazed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Consume Life Force

m.text: a humanoid organ gilded in naquatl worth 300gp

entries: You siphon the life force of an {@condition incapacitated} creature within range and absorb it, enhancing your own life force with it. If the creature remains {@condition incapacitated} throughout the casting of the spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of its casting. Roll {@dice 3d8}. On a failure, the creature's maximum hit points are permanently decreased by an equal amount, and your maximum hit points are increased by that same amount until the end of this spell. On a success, the creature loses  and you gain  half as many maximum hit points.

If the number you roll is higher that the creature's maximum hit point score, your maximum hit points are increased by an amount equal to the creature's maximum hit points. When a creature's maximum hit points are reduced to 0 in this way, it dies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the roll increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Curse of Nightmares
entries: You bestow a curse of madness on a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the target takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage and the spell ends. On a failure, the creature is cursed. While cursed, the creature is {@condition blinded} as it continues to see nightmarish visions even while awake. When another creature comes within 5 feet of a cursed target, it must make the same saving throw or contract the curse. The creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it touches the target. If a creature dies while cursed, its soul is consumed by the nightmares and it transforms into a nightmare wraith.

spell.name: Dark Blast
entries: You create a 5-foot-radius blast of dark energy centered on a point within range. Each creature within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.
If there is only one creature in the area of the spell, the creature has disadvantage on its saving throw and on a failure, it also becomes {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dark Ray
entries: Your hands can launch rays of darkness to corrupt any foe. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 90 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier necrotic damage, and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition blinded} for the duration of the spell. While {@condition blinded}, the creature can't regain any hit points and it has disadvantage on saving throws against curses. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action. You can only have one creature {@condition blinded} at a time with this spell. If you cause a new creature to become {@condition blinded}, the previous target ceases to be {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 6th level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th. If you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, you can launch two rays at a time as an action, and you can have two creatures {@condition blinded} at a time.

spell.name: Dark Tether
entries: You summon a tether made from darkness and launch it at a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be bound by the tether. While bound, the target cannot move or teleport to a space that is more than 30 feet away from you and it can't take any reactions. While the tether is active, you are also unable to move further away than 30 feet from the target and you are unable to willingly end your concentration on this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Death Grip
entries: You make a gripping gesture at a Medium or smaller creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, it is lifted 5 feet into the air, and its speed is reduced to 0. At the start of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failure, it takes another {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. You must have one of your hands free to maintain concentration on this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd. In addition, the size of the creature you can grip increases by one category for every two slot levels above 3rd, up to Huge.
Alternatively, you can choose to target an additional creature with this spell for each slot level above 3rd. Each target must be within 30 feet of another target of the spell.

spell.name: Death Seal
entries: You point at a creature you can see within range and draw the runic symbol of death in the air. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or the rune appears on their skin. For the duration of the spell, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws, it can't regain any hit points and loses any resistance to necrotic damage until the spell ends. If a feature would prevent it from being reduced to 0 hit points, it has no effect while this seal is active
Moreover, when the target takes damage, you can use your reaction to deal an additional {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage to it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Death's Cry

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range dies

entries: You tap into the passing soul of a creature and let the dying cry of its soul be heard. Each creature within 30 feet of the dying creature that isn't {@condition deafened} must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} psychic damage, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the creature is also {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Degenerate Mind
entries: You reach out and meddle with a creature's mind of your choice that you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its mental faculties be compromised for the duration of the spell. On a failure, the creature has disadvantage on any Intelligence checks and saving throws it makes, and the creature loses the ability to concentrate on any spells. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Denzar's Dimensional Vortex

components.m: a chipped piece of at least 6 different precious gems

entries: You tamper with the fabric of space and open a minute rip in the material realm at a point you choose within range. Any creatures in a 10-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d6} force damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also sucked into the vortex and deposited at a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated}. The target remains there until the end of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Denzar's Floor Charge
entries: You create a mesh of fluctuating energy on the ground at a point you can see within range. A 30-foot square of electrical energy appears centered on that point and lasts for the duration. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is in contact with the ground must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Denzar's Lightning Hellion
entries: You summon a ball of lightning that attempts to envelop a creature of your choice within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and becomes charged by the lightning hellion, with zaps of electrical energy surrounding its body. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

On each subsequent turn, you can use your bonus action to deal {@damage 2d6} lightning damage to the charged creature. Alternatively, you can use your bonus action to detonate the charge, causing a blast of electrical energy to emanate in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on the target. The target and each creature in the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. The spell then ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, all damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Denzar's Lightning Plex
entries: You summon a debilitating electrical current in the body of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it becomes shocked for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Dessicating Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon flares with dark energy, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage to the target. Additionally, any creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Destabilize Form
entries: You reach out with your mind and attempt to destabilize any magic influencing a creature's form. Target a creature within range. If the creature is currently being affected by any transmutation magic that is altering its form (such as the spells Polymorph, Alter Self, Barkskin, etc) or any other form-altering magical effects such as the Druid's Wildshape or the Shapechanger feature, that creature has to succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage and the spell ends. On a failure, its form becomes unstable for the duration of the spell. While its form is unstable, the creature is locked in its unstable form and is unable to change into something else. It is also unable to concentrate on any spell or effect other than the one its form requires.
The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on success. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage.

Additionally, when the creature makes an attack roll or saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant disadvantage on the roll, and when the creature takes damage, you can use your reaction to make it repeat the saving throw against the spell. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage, while on a success, the spell ends. The spell continues to affect the creature even after its form dissipates, e.g. its concentration on the polymorph spell is broken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level beyond 4th.

spell.name: Destabilizing Blast
entries: You hurl a ball of pure force against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d8} force damage, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes destabilized around magic and it has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects for the next minute. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Disassociating Touch
entries: You touch a creature within range and attempt to place their mind out of time. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage and at the start of its next turn, the creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} for the rest of its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Disguise Person
entries: You attempt to make a creature  including their voice, clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on their person  take on a different appearance. If the target is unwilling, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for its duration. You choose the illusory appearance they will take on. They can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You cant change their body type, so you must choose a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you. If you attempt to make their appearance mimic someone else, you must have seen that person.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to make a creature appear larger than they are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch them would go through the illusion, and their hand would feel nothing until they reach the actual existent body behind the illusion.

The affected target is not immediately aware that there has been a change in their appearance. If they look at themselves, whether through a reflective surface or by looking down at their body, they only see their regular appearance. This spell only affects a creature's appearance, not their behavior or personality, so they would act as they usually would, unaware of the effects. They become aware of the effect when it is pointed out to them, at which point they can make a Wisdom saving throw once more to end the effect on themselves.

To discern that the target is disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect their appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC. If the affected creature's behavior is a giveaway that there is something wrong, the check is made with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the casting grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Disorient
entries: You confuse the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} psychic damage. Any concentration checks it makes as a result of taking this damage are made with disadvantage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Dispelling Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, your weapon crackles with force, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d10} force damage to the target. Additionally, any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd. Also, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Disrupt Mind
entries: You attempt to disrupt the concentration of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Concentration check or lose its concentration.

spell.name: Divine Retribution

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range harm another creature with a spell or an attack

entries: You point your finger at the creature that committed harm, and set it for judgement against the holy forces that fuel you. The creature becomes marked by you, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition restrained}, while on a success its speed is reduced to half until the spell ends. If the creature failed the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the spell ends, while if it failed its saving throw by 10 or more, it is {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration.

The first time you hit the marked creature with an attack, or target it with a spell that deals radiant damage, your attack or spell deals an extra {@damage 5d10} radiant damage, which ignores resistance and immunity, and the spell then ends.

At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, it ends the {@condition restrained}, {@condition stunned} or {@condition paralyzed} conditions on itself, but it remains marked until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.
Enemies and Strife

spell.name: Dizzying Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon produces dizzying sound, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage to the target. The target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Draining Disease
entries: You touch a creature and infect it with a necrotic disease that lasts for the duration of this spell. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, and unless it is immune to diseases or curses it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes an additional {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt. While you maintain concentration on this spell, the target must repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, it takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 4th level spell slot or higher, the initial necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ebennight

components.m: an eben shard worth at least 2,500 gp

entries: You point at a space you can see within range and open a gateway to the realm of absolute darkness. Eternal blackness spreads from the point you chose and fills a 20-foot-radius sphere. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision or truesight can't see through this darkness, and no light can illuminate it. If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 9th level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

A creature that begins its turn within the darkness must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage as the blackness seeps into it, or half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, a creature also becomes {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and unable to speak for the duration of the spell, even if it exits the darkness, as it continues to live inside it. At the end of each of its turns, the creature must repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success and becoming immune to that effect of the spell for 24 hours. If the creature fails this saving throw three times, it stops making saving throws and the effects become permanent for it. A wish spell or a greater restoration spell cast at 9th level can cure the effects, as well as other means left to the discretion of the DM. If the creature is still in the area of absolute darkness when it makes its saving throw, it does so with disadvantage.
If you maintain concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the spell becomes permanent and the radius of darkness increases by 5 feet every 24 hours until it swallows everything.

spell.name: Elder Sign

m.text: primordial stone turned into dust which is consumed, worth at least 10,000 gp

entries: You carve the rune of the elder god in your skin. When you finish carving the rune, you gain 5 levels of {@condition exhaustion} and you must make a DC 20 saving throw with your spellcasting ability. On a failure, you die and you are immediately transformed to an aberration under the control of the DM, directly serving the elder god.

The Elder Sign can only be dispelled from your skin under special circumstances known only to the DM. While it is on your skin, you have immunity to necrotic and psychic damage, and aberrations cannot attack or harm you. You can telepathically communicate with any aberration you can see, and you have advantage on checks made to interact with them as they sense the sign of the elder god on your skin.
Additionally, your spell save DC increases to 22, unless it was already higher, and you become proficient in all saving throws.

When a creature starts its turn and it can see you, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. If the creature fails its saving throw by 10 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. A creature can choose to avert its eyes from you in order to avoid the saving throw. If it does so, it can't see you until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it sees you in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

spell.name: Eldritch Sacrifice

components.m: the symbol of a creature you conduct this sacrifice for

entries: You conduct this ritual over the body of an {@condition incapacitated} creature. When you finish casting the spell, the creature dies if its level or CR is lower than yours. If it has a soul, it is sent to the domain of the entity to which you sacrificed it, and you gain 10 temporary hit points in return. Once you've gained temporary hit points from this sacrifice, you can't do so again until 24 hours have elapsed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points you gain increase by 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: Your eyes turn an otherworldly color as you bestow yourself with the power to sense extraplanar influence. For the duration of the spell, any creatures that don't originate from the material plane are shrouded in an aura of unique color. To the discretion of the DM, you could inspect the aura and learn hints of their origin with a successful Intelligence (Arcana) check.
In addition, any magical auras that have an origin foreign to the material plane, such as abyssal or celestial magic, appear to glow in a unique way to your eyes.

spell.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: You imbue yourself with elemental power. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. While the spell is active, any time you roll damage of the type you selected and you roll a 1 or 2, you can reroll the die and must keep the new result, even if it is a 1 or 2.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a 2nd level spell slot or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration is 1 hour. Using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Elzecar's Electrifying Bolt
entries: You gather a powerful current in your hand and release it towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage and it can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. On a critical hit, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Elzecar's Faraday Cage
entries: You cover your body in electrical current. For the duration of the spell, any creature that touches you takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can cause a surge in the current. A random creature within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage.
If you take lightning damage while this spell is active, you take additional damage equal to the level of this spell, as the current is intensified.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Elzecar's Ray
entries: You launch a ray of electrical energy towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the target takes an additional {@damage 4d6} lighting damage and the spell ends.

On a failure, the ray stabilizes and forms a bond between you and the target. While you are within 30 feet of one another, the lightning ray connects the target to you, the creature remains {@condition paralyzed}.

spell.name: Emergency Transfer

time.condition: which you take when you are targeted by an attack or force to make a saving throw against an area of effect spell

entries: You use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you, causing the attack that targeted you to miss. If you are within the area of an effect that causes you to make a saving throw, such as the fireball spell, you no longer need to make the saving throw if you teleport to a point outside of its area of effect, escaping the explosion.

spell.name: Energy Dissipator Sphere
entries: You warp the energy balance of space in a 30 foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. For the duration, when the area of another spell or magical effect, such as fireball, extends into the sphere, it deals half as much damage to targets within the energy dissipator sphere. This spell only interacts with effects that deal damage by targeting an area, rather than targeting a creature directly.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the casting provides a duration that does not require concentration.

spell.name: Evil Eye

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range makes an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You glare at the triggering creature with your evil eye, causing it to make its roll with disadvantage. If it fails on the roll, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Expose Wound
entries: You attempt to viciously exacerbate a creature's open wound. If a creature of your choice that you can see within range is below its maximum hit points, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and its wound festers with necrotic energy. The next time a creature hits it with a melee weapon attack before the end of your next turn, roll {@dice 2d6}. You can choose whether the wounded creature takes necrotic damage equal to the roll, or the creature that hit the target regains hit points equal to half of the roll, as the attacker leeches its life force. If the wounded creature is undead, or does not have flesh and blood, you can't choose for the attacker to regain hit points in this way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the roll increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Faerie Burst
entries: You allow a burst of fey energy to emerge from your hand and fill the air in a 30-foot radius. When you do so, the presence of magic is briefly outlined in glittery spectacle, although you are unable to determine the type or nature of magic.

Any {@condition invisible} creatures in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the outline of their form briefly glitters as well. A creature other than you that is exposed to this spell more than once over the course of a minute must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Fate's Imbalance
entries: You disturb the balance of fate in a 30-foot cube centered on a point within range. For the duration, whenever a creature within the cube makes a {@dice d20} roll, you can use your reaction to give the creature advantage or disadvantage.

spell.name: Fibrosis

components.m: a pinch of a fibrotic's fibers

entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage and the spell ends. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition blinded} for the duration of this spell, as fibers sharp as needles, much like the one you used to cast this spell, begin to grow out of its eyes. Creatures that can't be {@condition blinded} are immune to this spell. A spell can't end the {@condition blinded} condition on the target unless it is cast at an equal or higher level than this spell.

A {@condition blinded} creature must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage, as the fibrotic fibers continue to burrow in its face, ravaging its eyes. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and the effect ends. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the target of the spell becomes permanently {@condition blinded} and disfigured, with the area around its eyes having turned to fibers. Only the regeneration spell or wish spells can restore the creature's eyesight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Finger Break
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and attempt to shatter the phalanges of one of its hands. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d4} bludgeoning damage and have its fingers crushed, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, the creature is unable to use its hand to hold or interact with any object, and if it attempts to cast a spell with a somatic component, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or the casting fails, and the spell slot is wasted. The effects last until the creature regains a number of hit points equal to the bludgeoning damage it took.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Fire Wave
entries: You point both your hands and close your eyes. A plume of fire is expelled in a 30-foot cone in that direction.
