Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also ignited. Ignited creatures take {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to extinguish the flames.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Force Blast
entries: You let out an intense energy blast from your hands against a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} if its size is Large or smaller.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Forced Speech
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and attempt to make them speak a certain message of your choice. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they can see you casting the spell, the effect fails. On a failed saving throw, the target must speak the exact words you speak as the Verbal component of this spell (a message of up to 25 words), in the exact same tone and volume as you. On a successful saving throw, the target doesn't realize anyone tried to affect it. Creatures immune to the {@condition charmed} condition are immune to this effect.

spell.name: Gain Knowledge

m.text: powdered sapphire dust worth at least 10gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You welcome into your mind the blessings of knowledge. You gain proficiency with a skill or tool of your choice for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Gain Superior Knowledge

m.text: powdered sapphire dust worth at least 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: Your deity grants you knowledge acquired through the ages by the collective of the humanoid races. You gain proficiency with one Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma skill of your choice. You can add double your proficiency modifier when making ability checks using that skill.

spell.name: Gain Supreme Knowledge

m.text: very rare tomes of both ancient and modern knowledge worth at least 2000gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You complete a ritual that symbolizes your devotion to the life of knowledge seeking, offering the tomes of knowledge you have amassed as tribute. For this ritual to succeed you must offer tomes that are worthy to be placed in a massive library that houses incredible amounts of knowledge in your deity's domain. If your tribute is accepted, the tomes are teleported into the plane of your deity when this spell is completed and you are granted with boons of knowledge for your service.

Choose an Intelligence skill with which you are proficient. You permanently gain expertise with that skill, which means you can add double your proficiency modifier on ability checks. Additionally, you always have advantage when making ability checks that use that skill.
Each time you cast this spell, the cost of the material components increase by 1000gp, which signifies the increasing rarity of the knowledge you have to acquire for it to be accepted as tribute.

spell.name: God Bane
entries: You reach out and twist the essence of one undead creature you can see within range, leaving it vulnerable to divine spells and effects. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the spell for its duration. The first time each turn the affected target takes radiant damage, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} damage. Moreover, the target loses any resistance to that damage type until the spell ends.

Additionally, when the creature makes a saving throw against divine spells, which are spells cast by clerics, paladins, druids, celestials, and other sources the DM deems appropriate, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result from its saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Golgariath's Curse of Fear

m.text: an object belonging to the target that is of emotional value, 1,000 gp worth of incense, which is consumed, and a voodoo doll resembling to the target

entries: You chant a curse of fear and bewitch a creature whose name you speak in this ritual. If the creature's name is true, the target becomes cursed. When you cast this spell, you designate an event, a circumstance, an item or a creature that will become a source of fear for the target. Each time the creature witnesses this creature or this event, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened}, it experiences immense anxiety and may stutter, avoid its source of fear or its function may otherwise become impaired. Example sources of fear include one's boss, one's enemy, the sight of a black cat, the sound of a coin dropping, or the sense of being pricked by a needle. The DM decides what are adequate and acceptable sources of fear. The creature can only make this saving throw once every minute.
The spell can only be dispelled by destroying the voodoo doll you used to cast this spell.

spell.name: Golgariath's Drain of Terror
entries: You target a {@condition frightened} creature within range and attempt to drive its fears beyond its mind's capacity to withstand. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 5d8} psychic damage and you gain half as many temporary hit points. The target also becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't become {@condition incapacitated}. You still gain temporary hit points equal to half of the damage you dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Golgariath's Psychic Bolt
entries: You gather negative psychic energy in your hands and unleash a bolt towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage. If the target is {@condition frightened}, you have advantage on the attack roll and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes to end the condition on itself.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Golgariath's Realm of Fear

components.m: shock-white hair of a dead humanoid

entries: You imbue a location within range with all of humanity's most debilitating fears. The first time you cast this spell targeting that location, any humanoid in an 1-mile radius of the point you choose starts feeling a sense of unease over the course of 24 hours. The second time you cast this spell, any humanoids within the affected area begin manifesting a sense of dread and peril over a course of 24 hours. If you cast this spell a third time, humanoid creatures within that same area find it unable to sleep without experiencing intense nightmares that disrupt their sleep, rendering them unable to rest within the area of nightmares. Humanoids within the settlement you affect find it unable to continue their lives as normal, and all sense of societal function soon fades away within the next few days.

Once you've cast this spell targeting the same location 3 subsequent times, each within 24 hours of the other, the spell gains a duration of 30 days. If you cast this spell once every month for a year, the spell's effects become permanent.

spell.name: Golgariath's Shroud of Terror
entries: You channel the fears of creatures that have died where you stand and shroud yourself with them. For the duration, any creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the start of its next turn. On each of your turns, you can use your bonus action to give a glance of terror towards a {@condition frightened} creature you can see within the aura of the spell. If the creature can see you as well, it makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Golgariath's Sphere of Terror
entries: You enchant a point you see within range to become a beacon of humanity's greatest fears. A 20-foot radius sphere forms centered on that point. Each creature that starts its turn in the sphere must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} until it exits the sphere. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't become {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature that starts its turn in the sphere makes its saving throw with disadvantage. On a success, the {@condition frightened} condition ends early on the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Gorgrung's Boulder Smash
entries: You launch a heavy boulder towards a point within range, where it shatters in phantasmagorical fashion. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Gravity Pull
entries: You target a Large or Huge creature that is in contact with the ground, and you create an intense gravitational well under them, using their own size against them. They must make a Strength saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save as their knees buckle under the gravitational strain, and they fall {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and the spell ends. For the duration, when a {@condition prone} target affected by this spell attempts to stand up, it must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage as it's slammed back to the ground, can't stand up from {@condition prone} for the remainder of its turn. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage of the spell increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the casting grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Grievous Bite

m.text: a bone of a particular creature type worth at least 300gp

entries: You summon the spectral jaw of a beast, monstrosity, or aberration and make an attack with it against a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and must succeed on a particular saving throw, depending on the bone of the creature you have used to cast this spell:
Beast. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
Monstrosity. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.
Aberration. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.
Fey. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn.
Celestial. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished until the end of its next turn.
Giant. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet.

Elemental. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} damage of a type determined by the material component of this spell (acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, poison).
Construct. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its AC is reduced by 1 until the end of its next turn.

Dragon. The target and each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} damage of a type determined by the material component of this spell (acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, poison).
Fiend. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, you have advantage the next time you attack it with this bite attack, and deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage.
Plant. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} until it escapes or you use the jaw to bite another target.
Undead. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.
For the duration of the spell, you can use your bonus action on each subsequent turn to make the same attack.
When you first learn this spell, you gain access or craft 1 component that corresponds to one of the above creature types. In your journeys, you might be able to find or buy more components.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Guardians of Peace
entries: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and any time an affected creature deals damage with an attack the amount of damage it deals is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. Creatures affected by the aura cannot deal lethal damage with their attacks. When a creature falls to 0 hitpoints as a result of such an attack, they are {@condition unconscious} but stabilized.

spell.name: Hollowing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon pulses with dark power. The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage to the target, and the target can't regain hit points until this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hunger to Kill

components.m: an obsidian scale ground into dust

entries: You select a willing creature you can see within range and imbue it with a hunger for killing. The creature gains 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns as long as it is within 30 feet of an enemy creature. When it makes a weapon attack that kills a creature, it can use its bonus action to make an additional attack.

If the target ends its turn without having damaged an enemy, the target takes psychic damage equal to its level, and you must succeed on a Concentration check or the spell ends. The DC is equal to the target's level.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 5 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Hurl Force

components.m: an object at least 100.000 years old, worth at least 1.000 gp

entries: You hurl a mote of undulating force towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage, and the orb splits in two fragments, targeting two creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the previous target. Make a ranged spell attack for each. If either of these orbs hit as well, the same effect occurs. When an orb splits in this way, you can choose its next target, but it must target a creature. If there is no creature within 30 feet of the previous target, the orb instead targets you. An orb can't target a creature that has already been targeted by another orb, unless that creature is you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10}.

spell.name: Hurl Force (Not Void)

components.m: a piece of duvrian ore worth at least 1.000 gp

entries: You hurl a mote of undulating force towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage and the orb splits in two fragments, targeting two creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the previous target. Make a ranged spell attack for each. If either of these orbs hit as well, the same effect occurs. When you cast this spell, roll {@dice 1d4} to determine the number of times that an orb can split for this casting of the spell.

When an orb splits in this way, you can choose its next target, but it must target a creature. If there is no creature within 30 feet of the previous target, the orb instead targets you. An orb can't target a creature that has already been targeted by another orb, unless that creature is you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10}.

spell.name: Ilidthen's Psychic Bomb
entries: You direct psychic energy to build up in a point within range and cause it to erupt. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} damage and become {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Incomprehensible Visions
entries: You produce visions of the incomprehensible realities of the far realm in a 30-foot radius sphere centered at a point you can see within range. Each creature in the area must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Induce Poison

components.m: a small amount of a poisonous substance

entries: You target up to two creatures you can see within range and attempt to poison them. Each target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the effect for it ends. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d10} poison damage and remains {@condition poisoned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Infernal Beckons
entries: You point your finger at a creature you can see within range and beckon it in the infernal tongue. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} fire damage and be teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of you. If there is no such space, the teleportation fails. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't teleported.

If a creature knows infernal, it can choose to willingly submit to your spell and appear {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. When it does so, it doesn't take any damage from the spell, but it can't stand up from {@condition prone} until the end of its next turn. If you know the name of a creature, you can target it with this spell even if you can't see it. The spell fails if the creature isn't in range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Intercept

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range move

entries: You reach out with your hands and manipulate the weave to summon a magical barrier in front of a moving creature's current path. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice). On a failure, its speed is reduced to 0 for the rest of the turn and it takes {@dice 1d4} of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet of movement speed it has. On a success, the target takes half as much damage, and its speed is not affected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the creature's speed is halved for the remainder of the turn on a successful saving throw. If you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can cause the creature's speed to be reduced to 0 even if it succeeds on the saving throw, but if you do so, it takes no damage on a successful save.

spell.name: Investiture of Light
entries: You chant a litany of light and lift yourself aloft. For the duration of the spell you have a flying speed of 60 feet, you shed bright light in a 30 foot radius, and you have resistance to radiant damage. When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you, and it can see you, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC if the light you shed touches it. On a failure, it becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of its turn. A creature that fails this saving throw also takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage if it is within 5 feet of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Investiture of Shadow
entries: You chant a litany of shadows and lift yourself aloft. For the duration of the spell, you have a flying speed of 60 feet, and you are coated in shadow. Attack rolls against you are made at disadvantage as long as you are in dim light or darkness and you have resistance to necrotic damage. If you start your turn in bright light, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take PBd6 radiant damage. The DC of the saving throw is determined by the DM or the effect that produces the light.

While you are flying and coated in darkness, you can use your bonus action to shoot a shadowy tendril against a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage. You can only make this attack if you are flying in dim light or darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ki Severance
entries: You sever a creature's connection with the life force of its body. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for the duration. While {@condition poisoned}, a creature cannot regain any hit points. A {@condition poisoned} creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
If the target has any levels in the monk class, it cannot use any ki points while {@condition poisoned}, but it has advantage on any saving throws it makes against the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature with the spell for each slot level above 3rd. Each target must be within 30 feet of another target.

spell.name: Laughing Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon forcefully produces mirth on the target, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage. The target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it begins laughing uncontrollably for the duration of the spell, becoming {@condition incapacitated}. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less or that can't be {@condition charmed} isn't affected. If the creature takes any damage, the spell ends.

spell.name: Life Siphon
entries: You tap into the life force of a creature you can see within range. Whenever parts of its vital energy are lost to the ether, you can siphon the remains into yourself. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or be affected by this spell unless it is undead. For the duration of this spell, you regain {@dice 1d6} hit points whenever the creature you have tapped into takes damage. You can only do so once per turn. If you ever end your turn more than 30 feet away from your target, the spell ends.

spell.name: Lightning Burn
entries: You transform yourself into a bolt of lightning and fly straight towards a point you can see within 120 feet of you. When you do so, you can go through the space of other creatures, but you can't go through solid objects. Any creature you traverse through must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

When your movement ends, you strike hard against the ground in the form of lightning before returning to your original shape. Any creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Lightning Buzz
entries: You cover yourself in a layer of static electricity that crackles around you. For the duration, any creature that touches you or starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage. A creature takes the same damage if it steps in a space within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn. A creature can only take this damage once per turn.

Moreover, you can use a bonus action to agitate this electric field. When you do so, a random creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} lightning damage, as it is randomly zapped.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Lightning Surge
entries: You let a surge of lightning burst from your fingers in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 foot wide. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage. A creature that is exactly 30 feet away from you also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn if it fails this saving throw. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Litany Against Fear

m.text: a piece of refined platinum worth at least 100 gp

entries: You ward yourself against fear and attacks of the mind. For the duration of the spell you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} condition, and resistance to psychic damage.

When you become {@condition frightened}, you can choose to end this spell on yourself and prevent the {@condition frightened} condition from taking hold. When you do so, you also gain 10 temporary hit points.

spell.name: Lying Whisper
entries: You whisper a short phrase of up to 10 words, which must be a lie, in the ear of a creature. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or believe that lie to be the truth. The effect lasts for 8 hours, after which the creature realizes it was {@condition charmed}. A creature immune to being {@condition charmed} is unaffected. The effect ends early if the creature witnesses direct proof of the lie being untrue, for example seeing their presumed dead brother alive.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the effect lasts for 24 hours. When you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, the effect lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Madden
entries: You assault the sense of self of a creature you can see within range, potentially causing it to go mad. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature can't take any reactions for the duration of the spell. At the start of each of its turns, a creature must roll a {@dice d6} which determines its behavior for that turn.

entries.caption: Maddened Behavior
rows: The creature uses all its movement to lunge towards a random direction and then fall {@condition prone}. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.
The creature tries to tear out its own eyes. It must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition blinded} until it regains any hit points.

The creature yells out in madness. Any creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 4d6} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

The creature attempts to bite a random creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or contract the effects of the same spell. While you maintain concentration on this spell, you affect all infected targets.

The creature shakes in convulsions. It takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and any creature that can see it within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it until the end of its next turn.

The creature's eyes blacken. It directs its sight towards a random creature within 30 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed. While cursed, it has disadvantage on all saving throws. The curse remains for the duration of the spell.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The targets must be within 30 feet of each other.

spell.name: Melodious Dirge
entries: You use your musical talent to play a melodious dirge, capable of both consoling and upsetting your audience. Any creatures of your choice that can hear your music in a 30-foot radius from you gain {@dice 4d4} temporary hit points. Creatures that you instead choose to hear the cursed side of your dirge must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d4} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. Any creatures that fail this save must also subtract {@dice 1d4} from the next saving throw they make within the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot, the temporary hit points and psychic damage increase by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Memory Scrambler

m.text: a pinch of zarkonium dust worth 25 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: Calling upon the mentally disorienting effects of zarkonium dust, you impart on yourself aspects of its effects. For the duration, when you interact with a humanoid creature while under the effects of this spell, you can cause that creature's memory to fail to store any memories from your interaction. If the creature attempts at any point after your interaction ends to remember particulars of its interaction with you, it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or fail to remember details of its interaction with you.

When a creature fails to remember details of its interaction with you, it cannot successfully specify your physical features and only has a vague awareness of the content of the interaction, though it remembers an interaction taking place.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can affect the memories of any creature, not only humanoids. The casting of the spell then requires double as much zarkonium dust.

spell.name: Mental Assault

components.m: a vial of the yellow liquid secreted from the fibers of a dead cereb

entries: You assault the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that is {@condition charmed} or {@condition blinded} has disadvantage on its saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mental Feedback
entries: When you see a spell being cast within range, you can attempt to twist its energy and cause mental feedback to the caster. The caster must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage, or half as much damage on a success. If the target rolls a natural 1 on its saving throw, it is also {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mental Fortification
entries: You reach out to touch a willing creature's mind and fortify it against assault. The target has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Mental Overload
entries: Target a creature you can see within range. The target's mind is flooded with debilitating amounts of information, and it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the target is also unable to concentrate on any spell and has disadvantage on intelligence checks for the duration of the spell. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mind-Whip Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon produces dizzying sound, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d6} psychic damage to the target. The target must also succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, or it can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. Moreover, on each of its turns, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Mirror Mirror
entries: You trace a sigil of connection over the surface of a mirror you touch, attempting to connect it with another mirror you know of, which has the same sigil. The corresponding mirror must be on the same plane of existence as you. For the duration, you can view through your mirror and see into the linked mirror. You can only receive visual information through the mirror, as you are unable to hear anything through it.

When you cast this spell, you can choose to create a sigil on a mirror, instead of attempting to view through it. When you cast the spell in this way, it has a casting time of 1 action, though it may still be cast as a ritual.

spell.name: Mischievous Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon produces hypnotic patterns, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 4d8} force damage to the target. The target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or you become {@condition invisible} to it for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Noxious Blast
entries: You hurl a noxious ball of poison at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} poison damage. Hit or miss, the ball of poison explodes into a 15-foot sphere of poison vapors. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take half as much damage. If the original target fails on this save, it also becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails the save by 10 or more also becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can choose whether to deal {@damage 1d6} extra damage for each slot level above 3rd, or increase the radius of the blast by 5 feet for each 2 slot levels above 3rd. You can also combine the two options.

spell.name: Null Harm

time.condition: which you take when you receive damage

entries: You channel the energy of the void as harmful energy strikes you, instantly nullifying it. You reduce the damage you take from the triggering effect to 0, by shunting the harmful energy to a parallel void realm. If the spell ends before its full duration elapses, the energy returns, striking you as it would normally have, and you take as much damage as you would have taken from this spell's triggering effect. If you concentrate on this spell for its full duration, the energy is siphoned off into nothing.

spell.name: Nullify

m.text: a rare and ancient object that belonged to a creature whose existence has been erased, worth at least 10,000 gp

entries: You erase the existence of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the target takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage and the spell ends. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. On a failure, the creature is instantly shunted out of the material realm, ceasing to exist for the duration of the spell. If you concentrate on this spell for its full duration, the target does not return and its existence is erased from the past, present and future. No one apart from you can remember its existence.

It is up to the discretion of the DM how its erasure will affect the timeline, as the act can have unpredictable consequences. For example, if you try to erase from existence a cruel warlord in order to prevent his crimes, a crueler one might take his place.

spell.name: Nullifying Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a weapon attack, you imbue it with the power of the void. The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} nulling damage, and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or be unable to cast spells until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Object Soulbond

m.text: a small magnet made of a rare mineral worth 300 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform an intricate ritual with galvanized metals and dust that binds an object to your soul. Choose an item to bind yourself to that is not larger than you. You always know the object's location with perfect accuracy when you are on the same plane of existence. If you are ever on a different plane, you know on which plane the object is, but not its precise location.

If you and the soulbound object are on the same plane of existence, you can use your action to create an {@condition invisible} sensor within 10 feet of the object that lasts for 10 minutes. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see {@condition invisible} objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist. When you use this ability, make a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC. On a failure, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.

Additionally, you can use an action to recall the object back to you. It appears on your person, or at an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. If the object is returned to you, so is the portion of your soul you had bound to the object, and the effects of the spell end.
Dispelling Variant

A character can attempt to discover a way to make this soulbond more permanent, and harder to sever. Doing so would require special materials that would be consumed by the casting of the spell. The DM decides what those materials are, and what quest is necessary to retrieve them. If you succeed in this enhanced casting of the spell, it gains the further benefits:

When dispel magic is successfully cast on the soulbound object, the spell is not permanently dispelled. Instead, the object becomes non-magical for 1 hour, as the magic in it is momentarily suppressed and you lose your connection to it for the duration.

Your bond to the object can be violently severed by effects such as the wish spell, and, to your DM's discretion, sophisticated dispelling rituals that are difficult to cast. If your connection to the item is ever violently severed in this way, you fall to 0 hp.

spell.name: Orb of Annihilation

m.text: an orb of immutable stone worth at least 1600 gp

entries: A 5-foot-diameter sphere of disintegrating force appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 10d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet potentially ramming it against a target. The target can be a creature or an object, but not a creation of magical force. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. The target is disintegrated if damage from this sphere leaves it with 0 hit points.
When you move the sphere, you can direct it towards any direction, and it can float unaided in the air. The sphere sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

spell.name: Orb of Chaotic Possibilities

m.text: a depiction of the void realm, rendered in materials worth at least 100 gp

entries: You pull a hissing mass of chaotic energy from the void realm and hurl it at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8 + 2d12} damage. Choose one of the {@dice d8}s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.
If you roll the same number on any {@dice d12}s, the creature suffers a random condition described below until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can roll either an additional {@dice 1d8} or an additional {@dice 1d12}. You can select any of the d8s when determining the type of damage the orb deals, and if you roll more than one set of identical numbers on the {@dice d12}, the target suffers all conditions.

spell.name: Paralyzing Fear
entries: You send shivers down the spine of a creature you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell. The spell has no effect on undead. While {@condition frightened}, a creature is {@condition paralyzed}. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, while on a success, the spell for it ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Pascal's Faltering Step

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range move

entries: You subtly point gesture at a creature and attempt to make its step falter. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or it is knocked {@condition prone}. To the common eye, the fall appears to be an accident. A creature must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to determine that there was a magical influence to the creature's fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Phase Wall
entries: You touch a piece of a wall that is no thicker than 1 foot and no wider than 5 feet. That part of the wall begins to glow a deep violet blue and its material begins to undulate as if it was liquid, becoming a conduit for arcane energy. Any magical projectile you attempt to shoot through through the wall will pass through the affected area of the wall, and you are considered to have an unobstracted path for spellcasting through that part of the wall. The wall does not show any signs of being enchanted on the other side, until magical energy passes through it. This spell does not allow you to see through the wall, or move through it. Any creature or object that comes in contact with the affected area of the wall takes {@damage 5d6} force damage.
Both sides of the wall will deal this damage once magical energy has passed through the conduit. If the wall is somehow demolished, the spell ends.

spell.name: Pierce
entries: You fire a beam of energy in a line originating from you that is 120 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in its wake must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 10d8} piercing damage.

An object takes twice as much damage, and if it is destroyed, a clear 5-foot wide gap is created through it. This beam has the potential of even piercing creations of magical force. If the beam impacts one, such as a wall of force, make a check with your spellcasting ability. The DC is equal to 10 + the level of the spell that created the effect. On a success, a 5-foot wide hole is punched into the space of the obstacle.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Piercing Bolt
entries: You fire off an arcane blast from your hand, meant to pierce through your enemy. Make a  ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage, and the bolt continues traveling through their body in a straight line for 10 feet. Any creature that the bolt strikes afterwards takes {@damage 1d4} force damage if the attack roll would hit it as well.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} and {@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Piercing Ray
entries: You aim a beam of transmutative energy against a target within range, such as a creature or a barricade. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage. The ray continues traveling up to 10 feet through the target. If it impacts against another creature or object, make another ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes half as much damage. Ranged spell attacks you make for this spell ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd. In addition, the ray continues traveling for an additional 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd, but it can only damage one additional target.

spell.name: Poison Bloom

components.m: the husk of a poison gland

entries: You concentrate poisonous material in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range. Each creature in the sphere when it appears or that starts its turn there must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} poison damage.
On subsequent turns while the spell lasts, you can use your bonus action to create another poisonous sphere in the same way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage each poison bloom deals increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Poison Plague
entries: You attempt to poison a creature you can see within range with foul energies. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} poison damage, or half as much damage on a success. If a target is {@condition poisoned}, it has disadvantage on this saving throw.

If a target fails its saving throw, you can select another creature within 30 feet of the original target, and force it to make the saving throw against this spell as well. The spell can continue spreading until no enemies remain, or a target succeeds on its save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Positional Transfer
entries: You target two creatures you can within range and attempt to switch their positions. The targets must be within 60 feet of each other and on the ground. An unwilling target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} force damage and be teleported on a failure. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and it isn't teleported.

A willing creature automatically fails the saving throw but takes half as much damage. For the positional switch to take effect, both creatures must be teleported. If one resists the effect, neither teleportation takes place.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Positive Energy Sphere
entries: You reach out and target an unoccupied space within range, letting energy from the positive plane suffuse the area in a radius of 30 feet. Any undead or negative energy creature          that starts its turn within the affected area must make a                                               Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects, depending on its distance from the target point of the spell.
Within 30 feet: the creature takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.
Within 20 feet: the creature takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and makes attack rolls with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.
Within 10 feet: the creature takes {@dice 4d8} radiant damage, and its maximum hit points are reduced by an equal amount. It makes attack rolls with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

Any other type of creature that starts its turn within the affected area benefits from its invigorating properties. A creature receives {@dice 2d4} temporary hitpoints if it is within 30 feet of the target point of the spell, and an additional {@dice 1d4} for each 10 feet closer it is to the point, up to {@dice 4d4}. While within 10 feet of the target point, a creature also gains advantage on all saving throws.

spell.name: Prismatic Bolt
entries: You hurl a multicolored ray of light at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} damage. The type of damage is determined by the result of the first damage die rolled:
1. Force damage, 2. Psychic damage, 3. Radiant damage, 4. Acid damage, 5. Thunder damage, 6. Lightning damage, 7. Cold damage, 8. Fire damage

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).
As an optional rule, the DM could rule that each damage die deals seperate types of damage, allowing the cantrip to deal additional types of damage as the character level increases.

spell.name: Protection of Spirit
entries: You touch a creature and bestow it with a ward to guard its spirit and keep out corruption. The target cannot be cursed for the duration, and it has advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

spell.name: Purifying Flame
entries: You cause a creature you can see within range to combust in purifying flames. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the creature is also cured of any diseases inflicting it, and any creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the target can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to half of the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Radiant Bolt
entries: You hurl a ray of light at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage and begins shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the creature with something opaque blocks the light.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Ravaging Flame
entries: You summon a ravaging sphere of flame at a point you can see within range. The sphere has a radius of 10 feet, and you can use your bonus action to move it up to 30 feet on your turn. Any creature that starts its turn in the flames must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Ravenous Panic
entries: You speak words that are highly upsetting to the mind of a target within range, causing it to be flooded by existential dread and panic. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 27 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage and, for the duration of the spell, it must use its action during its turn to attack a random creature within its range. If a creature can make multiple attacks with its action, either through its Attack or Multiattack action, it selects targets for each attack randomly. If no creatures are within its range, it uses its movement to move towards the nearest creature it can see and then attack. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes the same damage but is otherwise unaffected.

At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage on a failure, or ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature made no attacks during its turn, the effect ends on it regardless of the outcome of the save. The effect on the creature also ends if it is targeted by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

spell.name: Ray of Cold
entries: You launch a ray of extreme cold against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of its next turn. On a critical hit, the target becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Darkness
entries: You let darkness spread from your fingers in a 30-foot long, 5-foot wide line. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. For the next minute, the area is filled in magical darkness. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Read Memory

components.m: an object belonging to the target

entries: You begin the process of delving into the memory of an {@condition incapacitated} creature within range. The creature must remain {@condition incapacitated} for the whole casting of the spell, or the casting might have unforeseen consequences (to the discretion of the DM). For example, the spell might fail or psychically damage the target.

When you finish casting the spell, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw, or you gain access to one of its memories that you describe at the beginning of the process. You might specify a specific time, such as "12 hours ago" or "midnight 4 night ago". Alternatively, you can specify a situation, such as "the murder of the mayor", or a combination of time and situation, such as "the conversation with your boss yesterday".

If there is a relevant memory in the target's mind, you gain access to it as if it was your memory. The memory you retrieve can't be longer than 1 hour. If you specify a situation that lasts longer than that, the DM decides what part of the memory you retrieve. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this spell's effects for 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the memory you retrieve can be up to 6 hours long. If you cast this spell with a 7th level spell slot, the memory can be up to 1 day long. If you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, you can gain access to all the memories that match a situation you specify, regardless of their duration or chronology. For example, if you specify the situation "all the people you've killed", you will gain access to memories of every killing the target has committed.

spell.name: Relocate
entries: You target a creature or a tiny object you can see within range and attempt to teleport it to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of you. That space must be on the ground or on the floor. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} force damage and be teleported. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't teleported.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Repelling Force
entries: You fire a repelling blast in a 5-foot wide and 90 feet long line in a direction of your choice. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} thunder damage and be pushed 10 feet away from you. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. A flying creature has disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failure, it must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw to stay aloft due to the turbulence, or it falls {@condition prone}. The DC is 10 or half of the damage taken, whichever number is higher.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Reverb

time.condition: which you take when a target within 30 feet of you takes thunder damage

entries: When a target within 30 feet of you takes thunder damage, you can use your reaction to use the reverb. A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} thunder damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. If the target that makes this save is the creature that dealt the thunder damage, it has disadvantage on this saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rodrun's Siphoning Sphere
entries: You form a sphere of necrotic energy meant to siphon the life force of others and launch it at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Roll {@dice 1d6} for each creature that failed its saving throw, up to {@dice 4d6}. You gain that many temporary hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage and the limit of the {@dice d6} you can roll increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rodrun's Visceric Blast
entries: You hurl a mass of necrotic energy in the form of black goo against a creature or a point within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10 + 30} necrotic damage. If the creature is killed by this damage, its body explodes, spreading black viscera and necrotic goo in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw (its choice), taking 30 necrotic damage on a failure, or 15 on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

If you miss, or if you target a point in space, the projectile explodes in the vicinity, covering everything in the black substance it was made of. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the target was a creature, it makes this saving throw with disadvantage. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The ground of the sphere then becomes difficult terrain for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the radius of each explosion increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Sealed Fate
entries: You look forward into the future of a creature you can see within range. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be affected by the spell. On a failure, roll a {@dice d20} and record the result. The next attack roll, ability check or saving throw the target makes must use this roll.

spell.name: Sense Arcana
entries: You wave an incantation with your fingers, aimed to agitate the magical energies nearby, revealing their presence through vibrations on the tip of your fingers. If there are any magical effects within 30 feet of you, you sense their presence, but not their direction or characteristics.

spell.name: Sense Fear
entries: You target a creature you can see with a dark glance and attempt to dig up and survey its fears. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or you learn of the last nightmare it had, and a vague sense of the fears it represents. If the creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, you can ask the DM and learn if the creature is {@condition frightened} of a specific event, creature or idea you mention, or you can choose to learn of one fear it has, usually the most intense one or the most relevant to the moment.

Alternatively, you can use this spell to locate creatures overtaken by fear. You learn the direction of any {@condition frightened} creatures within 1000 feet of you, even if they are behind total cover, as their fear registers as a sweet odor to your nostrils.

spell.name: Sense Fingerprints

components.m: the object used as the target in the casting

entries: You touch an object and seek to detect creatures that have previously touched it. If a creature you see within 60 feet of you has touched the object within 24 hours, you see a glowing aura on their fingers. The intensity of the aura is equivalent to how long ago the creature touched the object.

spell.name: Serenade of the Void
entries: You emit the song of the void, drawing the minds of nearby creatures into a torpor. For the duration, any creature that begins its turn within 20 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. After a creature succeeds on this saving throw, it is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 hour.
Your song is audible out to a range of 60 feet. To the discretion of the DM, a creature that hears the song for the first time but can't see its source might feel compelled to investigate.

spell.name: Servile Impulse

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range starts its turn

entries: When a creature you can see within range starts its turn, you can use your reaction to attempt to impose a servile impulse at its mind. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you can telepathically give it a command that it must follow during its turn. This can be a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object."
A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} is immune to the effects of this spell, as is a creature that has Legendary Actions.

spell.name: Shadow Wreathe

m.text: a thread of darkness worth at least 200 gp

entries: You wreathe you hand in shadows that dance around it. For the duration, and as a part of casting this spell, you can use your action to launch a ray of darkness at a creature you can see within 120 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. If the creature is in darkness, you have advantage on the roll, and disadvantage if it is in bright light. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage. If you miss, you take necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage on a hit increases by {@dice 1d10}, and the damage you take on a miss increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Share Knowledge

m.text: powdered sapphire dust worth at least 10gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a willing humanoid creature, and let a piece of knowledge flow from your mind to theirs. You can either grant the creature proficiency with a tool that you are also proficient with, share a piece of information with it, or share more complicated knowledge with it. This spell has no effect on creatures with an Intelligence score of 4 or lower.
If it is a piece of information, they understand it instantly, and know it to be true if you do as well. The information does not leave their mind after it has been shared.

If you attempt to share a complicated piece of knowledge that is more than information, for example the laws of thermodynamics, the creature must make an Intelligence check if the DM deems that the creature is not intelligent enough to understand the knowledge you share with it. On a successful check, the creature retains the knowledge that has been shared with it. On a failed check, the creature fully understands what you shared with it, but the knowledge leaves its mind after 1 minute. Depending on the complexity of the knowledge you attempt to share, the DM might require you to spend a higher level spell slot when casting this spell.
If you choose to grant the creature a tool proficiency, the effect lasts for 1 hour.

spell.name: Shield of Life Force
entries: Choose a willing creature in range. That creature rolls one of its hit-dice and adds its Constitution modifier to the roll, expending the die in the process as a gleaming shield powered by the creature's life force forms around them. Alternatively, you can power the shield with your own life force, expending one of your hit-dice.

For the duration, the shield has a number of hit points equal to the result of the die roll and causes any critical hit dealt against the target to be turned to a normal hit while it remains active. Any damage dealt to the creature is dealt to the shield first, with the creature receiving any remaining damage. If the shield is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the creature can expend an additional hit die for each slot level above 1st, adding its Constitution modifier to each roll.

spell.name: Shielding Wards
entries: You mutter a few words of arcane warding, and form a number of arcane wards which continue to revolve around you in a 20 foot radius. For the duration, you have a +2 bonus to your AC and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of your turns. When a creature you can see is hit by an attack, or targeted by the by the magic missile spell, you can use your reaction to command one of the wards to protect that creature if it is within range. The creature gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and until the start of its next turn, that creature has a +2 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and takes no damage from magic missile.

spell.name: Shroud of Impossibilities

m.text: a void rune carved on a stone worth at least 500 gp

entries: You shroud yourself with visions of endless impossibilities. For the duration of the spell, a creature must make an Intelligence saving throw when it first sees you or when it begins its turn and it can see you. On a failure, it takes psychic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it takes twice as much damage, and it is considered to be {@condition blinded} to you until it makes this save again. If it fails its save by 10 or more, it takes three times as much damage and it is {@condition incapacitated} for the rest of its turn.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes if it chooses. It is considered to be blind to you until it stops averting its eyes. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw isn't affected by this spell for 24 hours.

spell.name: Shunting Touch
entries: You touch a creature within range and attempt to shunt it to another location. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d10} force damage and must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be shunted to an unoccupied space you can see within 20 feet of you. That space must be on the ground or on the floor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd. The distance that you can teleport the target also increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sinister Influence

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range makes an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You extend your beguiling influence towards a creature that is friendly or neutral towards you, unaware of your bad intentions. If the creature isn't hostile to you, it gains disadvantage on the roll. The creature then makes a Wisdom (Insight) ability check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check. On a failure, it remains unaware of your influence. On a success, it gains a vague sense of a malevolent influence on its person.

spell.name: Slash
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and gesture in a slashing motion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d10} slashing damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature begins bleeding. When a bleeding creature regains a number of hit points, it regains half as many hit points as it normally would. The bleeding stops when a target spends a hit die as part of a short or long rest in order to stop the bleeding.

A creature with a healer's kit can spend a minute and make a Medicine check against your spell save DC in order to allow the bleeding creature to expend a hit die. On a success, the hit die is expended and the bleeding stops on the creature. On a failure, the hit die is expended but the bleeding does not stop.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Soldier's Fortitude

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see within range is reduced to 0 hit points

entries: You empower an ally to make a last stand. The spell's target can use its reaction to make a death saving throw. On a success, the target is reduced to 1 hit point instead. On a failure, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points and gains a failed death save. The creature has a bonus to the roll equal to the level of the spell.

spell.name: Soldier's Valor

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see within range is reduced to 0 hit points

entries: You empower an ally to make a last stand. The spell's target can use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against an enemy. If the enemy creature has Legendary Actions, the attack is made with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the attack also deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each slot level above 2nd, to a maximum of {@dice 3d8}.

spell.name: Somber Dirge
entries: You play a somber dirge using your musical instrument. Your music affects creature in a radius of 30 feet from you, but it is audible up to 300 feet away. Any creatures of your choice within range have resistance to necrotic damage for the duration of the spell. In addition, creatures make death saving throws with advantage, and don't suffer any failed death saving throws when they take damage while they have 0 hit points.

spell.name: Sphere of Confluence

components.m: a vial of the yellow liquid secreted from the fibers of a dead cereb

entries: You visualize the magic suffusing the air around you, and swirling iridescent colors begin to fill the atmosphere in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range. For the duration, any creature that casts a spell in the affected area must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} force damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spread Rumor

m.text: a mermaid's seashell worth at least 300 gp

entries: You speak a rumor into the air and let your magic carry it to the right ears. Make an ability check with your spellcasting ability. The DC depends on the size of the settlement you are currently in. The DM might also increase or decrease the DC depending on the nature of the rumor you are trying to spread and the nature of the settlement you are currently in. On a success, your rumor successfully spreads within 24 hours.

spell.name: Spreading Death
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and assail it with necrotic energy. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 8d4 + 30} necrotic damage. If the creature dies, the creature that is nearest to it within 30 feet must make the same saving throw or suffer the same effects. Each time a creature dies by this spell, the effect spreads to the nearest creature within 30 feet, until a creature succeeds on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 3d4} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Steel Mind
entries: Target a creature you can see within range. That creature's mind receives an unprecedented ability to focus. The creature has advantage on Concentration checks, and Wisdom and Intelligence saving throws. In addition, if the creature's concentration on a spell is ever broken, it can use its reaction to steel its mind, refusing to give up. It maintains concentration on the spell, but it takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each spell level it is concentrating on. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the creature doesn't take damage when it uses its reaction to steel its mind. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the creature cannot have its concentration broken as long as it is unwilling.

spell.name: Stifling Touch
entries: You reach for the flesh of a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, if the creature would receive healing, it instead takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Stop Harm

time.condition: which you take when you or a creature within range becomes the target of an attack

entries: You yell out halting words at the attacker after seeing their intent to enact violence. If you share at least one language with the target, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or they lose their attack. If they succeed on the saving throw, or cannot understand you, they instead make the attack roll with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
