entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Summon Cyber Spirit

m.text: data nodes worth at least 300gp

entries: You call forth a spirit made of networked information.  It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Cyber Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a type: Stability, Magnetism or Misinformation. The creature resembles a semi-corporeal form made of web-like data connections. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Summon Object

m.text: precious metal or stones worth at least as much as the object you are attempting to summon, which are consumed

entries: You attempt to summon an object to your person. The object must be small enough to fit into your palm, and you must have held it at least once in the past. If the object is not worn or carried, or attuned to another creature, it is summoned in your hand or at your feet within 5 feet of you.

If the object is worn or carried by another creature, the creature can make a Charisma saving throw to prevent the effect from taking place. If the object belongs to the creature, it has a +5 bonus to this save. On a success, the spell fails and you can't target the same object again with this spell for 24 hours. On a failure, the object is teleported to you. The DM determines whether the creature is aware of the effect. If the object isn't on the same plane of existence as you, the spell fails. The spell also fails if you target a magical item that has a rarity of very rare or higher.

spell.name: Summon Person

m.text: an object belonging to the person being being summoned; an Eldritch Runestone worth at least 1,500 gp, which is consumed

entries: You name a humanoid creature you are familiar with and focus on an object that belongs to them. Make a check with your spellcasting ability. If the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, it is teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of you, providing that space is on the ground or on a floor. The DC of the check is equal to 10 + the CR or level of the creature. The DC can be modified by the following factors or other factors left to the discretion of the DM.

entries.caption: Relation to Target
rows: Secondhand (you have heard of the target)
Willing (the target knows you and it is willing)

entries.caption: Connection to Target
rows: An object that has been in the target's possession for more than 10 years
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like

entries: On a failure, the target isn't teleported and and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours. Additionally, the target knows the nature of the spell that was attempted against it. If a creature has the Legendary Resistance trait, it can expend a use of the trait to automatically resist the effect.

spell.name: Summon Time Spirit

m.text: a time strand native to the realm of time worth at least 400 gp

entries: You call forth a spirit native to the time realm. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Time Spirit stat block, and appears to be a floating mote of ethereal energy. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Summon Void Spirit

components.m: an object with a void rune engraved on it, worth at least 600 gp

entries: You call forth a void spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Void Spirit|MNG} stat block. When you cast this spell, choose a family of dragon: chromatic, gem, or metallic. The creature resembles a dragon of the chosen family, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Swirling Shadows
entries: You raise a mass of swirling shadows to envelop a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage and be enveloped by the shadows, taking half as much damage on a success. If the creature is in total darkness, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

A target that is enveloped by the shadows is considered to be heavily obscured by the darkness that covers it, unless a creature has the ability to see through magical darkness. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage on a failure, or ending the effect on itself on a success. If this damage kills a creature, the shadows leap to a random adjacent creature forcing it to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be enveloped by the shadows.

When a creature dies in this way, you can use your reaction to control the shadows and direct them at a creature of your choice within 30 feet of them. When you do so, there is a 5% chance that the shadows disobey you and launch themselves towards you. You cannot willingly end your concentration on this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Symphony of Destruction
entries: You begin playing a symphony of destruction. Your music expands in a shockwave originating from you out to a radius of 60 feet. Any creatures of your choice must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 10d6} thunder damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

Your music continues by suffusing the area in a 60-foot radius around you. Any creature within that area is {@condition deafened}, and for the duration of the spell, whenever a creature of your choice within range takes damage, you can cause it to take 5 additional damage of the same type.
Additionally, you can use your bonus action on each of your turns to cause any creatures of your choice in the affected area to take {@damage 3d6} thunder damage.

spell.name: Temporal Banishment
entries: You focus temporal energy around a creature you can see within range and attempt to momentarily shunt it out of normal spacetime. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished to a harmless dimension outside spacetime. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and remains there until the spell ends, viewing incomprehensible images from different points in time. If the spell ends before its whole duration elapses, the target reappears in a disoriented state in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. The target might not realize what point in spacetime it has returned to, and might have trouble remembering the events surrounding the time it left. For the next minute, the target is under the effects of the confusion spell, as it has trouble reintegrating into its reality. The target can make a save to end the effect as normal at the end of each of its turns, but the effect is not magical in nature and thus can't be dispelled.
If the spell's whole duration elapses, the target does not return. Instead it is shunted to a random point in time, in the past or future.

spell.name: Temporal Rejuvenation

m.text: a time strand native to the realm of time worth at least 3,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a willing creature, and over the course of 1 minute, allow its body and mind to experience the time passage of a full day. The target gains the benefits of a full rest.

spell.name: Torving's Flesh of Fire

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see attempts to grapple you

entries: You wreath your body in hot flames, granting the creature disadvantage on the ability check made to grapple you. For the duration, a creature that ends its turn while grappling you takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage, and you have advantage on ability checks made to escape a grapple. If at any point in the duration of the spell you are no longer {@condition grappled}, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Trace Telepathy
entries: While this spell is active, you know whenever a creature within 60 feet of you is receiving a telepathic message, or a message from a spell such as sending.

When a creature within 60 feet of you receives a message, you can use your reaction to attempt to tap into the magical connection and intercept the information being conveyed. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you can choose to either learn the content of the message, or the current location of the creature from which the sending message is being sent. On a success, you learn no information and the target is aware that there was an attempt to trace the sending message.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell's duration becomes 8 hours. If you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th level or higher, it lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Tripping

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see moves out of your reach

entries: You point towards the feet of a creature moving out of your reach, and muttering a few arcane words, you attempt to make the creature trip. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or trip and fall {@condition prone}.

spell.name: True Aurunist Rune
entries: You ward a temple or place of safety and worship against necromancy and undeath. The area can be as small as a 30-foot cube or as large as a 90-foot cube. While the effect lasts, no undead creature can enter the warded area, and all attempts made to cast necromancy spells within it automatically fail.
This effect can be dispelled only by a dispel magic spell of equal or higher level, or a similar spell of equal or higher level that can end spells and magical effects.

spell.name: Tyrant's Wane
entries: You target a creature you can see within range with crippling energy, seeking to deflate all of its power. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. This spell ignores the effects of Legendary Resitance. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions for the duration of the spell, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that have less current hit points that it does, and its movement provokes attacks of opportunity even if an effect such as the disengage action would cause it not to.

Additionally, when the creature attempts to use any Legendary Actions, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or its Legendary Actions for that turn are wasted. The creature expends its Legendary Actions as normal, but the effect is canceled. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
Enemies and Strife.

spell.name: Void Shunt
entries: You touch a creature and detach them from reality. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be shunted to the void realm until the end of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it dies and its soul is permanently shunted to the void realm.
When the creature returns to reality, it takes another {@damage 6d10} psychic damage.

spell.name: Void Step
entries: You teleport yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Any creatures within 10 feet of the point at which you arrive must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature also gains a void affliction determined by the following table. Roll {@dice 1d4}. The affliction lasts until the end of your next turn. When you cast this spell, you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or gain a random void affliction as well for the same duration. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level.

entries.caption: Void Affliction
rows: The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
The creature has disadvantage on all saving throws.
The creature's speed is reduced to 0.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wall of Void

components.m: a small piece of null-soaked phosphorus

entries: You bend spacetime to form a wall of void on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} nulling damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there

When a creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the wall, its density forms a gravity well that threatens to swallow them. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or be pulled 10 feet towards the wall until they enter it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wanton Destruction
entries: When you cast this spell, one random creature within range (including you) takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. If that creature is reduced to 0 hit points, the necrotic surge continues spreading and another random creature suffers the same effects. This spell can affect a number of targets equal to the level of the spell. This includes the original target of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the spell can affect an additional target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Warmage's Mark
entries: You focus on the magic coursing in your veins and mark a creature you can see with it. Until the spell ends, your spell attack rolls against the target ignore half and three-quarters cover. Additionally, when you target the marked creature with a cantrip spell attack and you miss, you can use your reaction to reroll the attack and take the new result.

spell.name: Wiretap
entries: You touch a creature and infuse their physical body with arcane energy. If the creature is unwilling, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw, or be affected by the effects of the spell. On a failure, choose one of the following effects:
Stalking. For the duration, you know the creature's location and how far away it is from you if it is within 1 mile of you.
Interception. For the duration, when the creature receives telepathic a telepathic message, or a message from a spell such as sending, you know the contents of the message.

spell.name: Wrapping Touch
entries: You reach for the flesh of a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and becomes {@condition grappled} by you until the start of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Zealous Accusation
entries: You point your finger at a creature you can see that is to bear judgement, and cause the weight of the divine scales to burden its shoulders. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it can't move or be moved away from you by any means, including teleportation or travel to the ethereal plane, and you can't have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. When it makes an attack or casts a spell targeting one of your allies, you can use your reaction to force it to make the same saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage, while on a success it takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.
Enemies and Strife.
